title: Rotational dynamics - ang acceleration three axes

content.question: Two spheres, with masses <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> and <math alttext="3 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>m</mi></math>, are connected by a rod of negligible mass, as shown. Three rotational axes are labeled in the figure. Axis <math alttext="B " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> passes through the center of mass of the spheres-rod system, which is represented by the dot, and axes <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math> are both a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> from Axis <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>. If the same torque is exerted on the system as it rotates about each of the three axes, which of the following correctly compares the angular accelerations <math alttext="alpha sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="alpha sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="alpha sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math> of the spheres-rod system about axes <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="alpha sub A, equals alpha sub B, which equals alpha sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mspace width="0.1em"></mspace><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mspace width="0.1em"></mspace><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="alpha sub C is greater than alpha sub B, which is greater than alpha sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>α</mi><mi>C</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mspace width="0.1em"></mspace><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mspace width="0.1em"></mspace><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, alpha sub A equals alpha sub C, close parenthesis, is greater than alpha sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mspace width="0.1em"></mspace><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mspace width="0.1em"></mspace><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="alpha sub B is greater than, open parenthesis, alpha sub A equals alpha sub C, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mspace width="0.1em"></mspace><mspace width="0.1em"></mspace><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="alpha sub B is greater than, open parenthesis, alpha sub A equals alpha sub C, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mspace width="0.1em"></mspace><mspace width="0.1em"></mspace><msub><mi>α</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
